column4: i'd like to ask you, I have a problem. Whenever I install dkms package, I get a disk error at startup (UNC error). I need dkms in order to use nvidia drivers. If I don't install them, my computer graphics suck!
can I make synaptic install dkms at another part of the disk, which is not ruined?
I though you didn't have to install dkms normally, it works with just pulling in the the nvidia driver...
If the disk is defective, run fsck (sudo touch /forcefsck  and reboot)
I tried to run fsck but when it finds the bad sector it stops
synaptic says dkms is needed to get nvidia drivers installed
ok, does fsck say anything else (at that point you might have to boot up on a livecd and run fsck with some parameters)
hmm, I guess dkms is installed by default per standard...
it says something about cleaning orphaned i node #####
then hopefully no disk errors...
but at startup, the bar for ubuntu loading freezes and I get errors
{DRDY ERR} and then error:{UNC}

possibly, I don't really know... maybe the errors crop up in another application then... *really has no idea*
